street.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a public road in a city or town that has houses, shops etc on one or both sides
street.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: We moved to Center Street when I was young.
She lives just a few streets away.
I walked on further down the street.
Someone just moved in across the street.
a car parked on the other side of the street
street.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: The house faces onto a busy street.
crowded
The streets get very crowded at weekends.
It was late and the streets were quiet.
empty/deserted
As he walked home, the street was deserted.
an old city with quaint narrow streets
the main street
They drove slowly along the main street.
the high street
I bought this coat at a shop on the high street.
a shopping street
This is one of Europe’s most elegant shopping streets.
a residential street
a quiet residential street
a one-way street
He was caught driving the wrong way down a one-way street.
a side/back street
The restaurant is tucked away in a side street.
winding streets
We spent hours exploring the town’s winding streets.
cobbled streets
The cobbled streets were closed to cars.
cross the street
She crossed the street and walked into the bank.
street + NOUN
a street corner
Youths were standing around on street corners.
a street light/lamp
It was getting dark, and the street lamps were already on.
street crime/violence
Young men are most likely to be victims of street crime.
street clothes
She changed into her street clothes and left the theatre.
street.translation[1].definitions[0].def: relating to or similar to fashions, types of music, or attitudes that are popular with young people in cities
